availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Residence: Bracken County, Kentucky. An Albany, New York-born carpenter. Married Nancy Cummins. Father of James Allen Agrue, Mary Ellen Agrue, Henry Bascom Agrue, Malinda Jane (Agrue) Bartimus, Charles Bruce Agrue, and Emma Adeline (Agrue) Davis.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, Entry for Henry Wheeler Agrue (1817-1889), Find A Grave Memorial # 107968143, Mount Zion Cemetery, Elliottstown, Effingham County, Illinois, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=107968143&ref=acom (accessed 17 Jul 2017).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Palma post office, p. 850.
